name: Shadow
lore: Shadows are undead that resemble dark, incorporeal silhouettes of their former selves. They lurk in dark places, draining the strength of the living and spawning new shadows from the corpses of those they slay. Created through necromantic rituals, foul curses, or the pervasive gloom of the Shadowfell, a shadow retains no memory of its former life, only an insatiable hunger for the vitality of living creatures.
resistances: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, and Thunder
Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from nonmagical attacks

understood: the languages it knew in life
languages.notes: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.description: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow has Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.description: While in sunlight, the shadow has Disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a Short or Long Rest. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

hit.additionalEffects: The target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a Short or Long Rest. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.
